alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 1:15PM PST until March 08 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches, highest near Weed and in the mountains on the western flank of the Valley. * WHERE...The Shasta Valley in Central Siskiyou County, including I-5, and highways 96, 3, and a portion of 97 east out of Weed. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts are expected to reach 20 and 40 mph, which could lead to drifting snow and brief periods of blowing snow with low visibility. These windy conditions should peak from 4 PM to 10 PM. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
